documents.document: Freedom is the right to question and change the established way of doing things. ~Ronald Reagan
I have often thought that morality may perhaps consist solely in the courage of making a choice. ~Leon Blum
The worst feeling is when something is killing you inside, and you have to act like you don’t care.
Find the sweetness in your own heart, then you may find the sweetness in every heart. ~Rumi
Focusing on what gives you pain only keeps you in pain. Focusing on what gives you joy brings joy into your life. ~Jerry Corstens
Every struggle you had in your life shaped you into the person you are today. Be thankful for the hard times they can only make you stronger.
Make the rest of your life the best of your life.
There is only one person who could ever make you happy, and that person is you. ~David Burns
Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment. ~Buddha
We all have possibilities we don’t know about. We can do things we don’t even dream we can do. ~Dale Carnegie
The secret of success in life is for a man to be ready for his opportunity when it comes. ~Benjamin Disraeli
All improvement in your life begins with an improvement in your mental pictures. ~Brian Tracy
Good manners sometimes means simply putting up with other people’s bad manners. ~H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
Life is all about taking risks. If you never take risks, then you’ll never know what you’re capable of.
Even a mistake may turn out to be the one thing necessary to a worthwhile achievement. ~Henry Ford
All of us do not have equal talent, but all of us should have an equal opportunity to develop our talents. ~John F. Kennedy
There is always one moment in childhood when the door opens and lets the future in. ~Deepak Chopra
In life you are either a passenger or a pilot, it’s your choice.
Expectation is the root of all heartache. ~Shakespeare
The real friendship is like fluorescence, it shines better when everything has darken. ~Rabindranath Tagore
You may have not gone where you intended to go, but you will end up where you need to be.
You must do the thing which you think you cannot do. ~Eleanor Roosevelt
A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it. ~Jean de La Fontaine
If you’re brave enough to say goodbye, life will reward you with a new hello.
The world is but a canvas to the imagination. ~Henry David Thoreau
The first step before anyone else in the world believes it is that you have to believe it. ~Will smith
Like the formula for failure, the formula for success is easy: a few simple disciplines practiced every day. ~Jim Rohn
Once you’ve accepted your flaws, no one can use them against you.
I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter. ~Walt Disney
Weeds choke up an unused path, Go often to the important places in your life. ~Robert Allen
The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate. ~Oprah Winfrey
Success has always been easy to measure. It is the distance between one’s origins and one’s final achievement. ~Michael Korda
What makes or breaks a man is not what people think of him, but what he thinks of himself. ~Seyi Eyiayo
Being hurt is inevitable, being miserable is an option. ~Louis Martin Jr.
Fear is stupid. So are regrets. ~Marilyn Monroe
Challenges are what make life interesting. Overcoming them is what makes life meaningful.
For all life is a dream, and dreams themselves are only dreams. ~Pedro Calderon de la Barca
Everybody believes in something and uses that something to support their own existence. ~Frank Zappa
The most important thing in life is to learn how to give out love, and to let it come in. ~Morrie Schwartz
When the power of love overcomes the love of power the world will know peace. ~Jimi Hendrix
All the things that truly matter, beauty, love, creativity, joy and inner peace arise from beyond the mind. ~Eckhart Tolle
Stop beating yourself up. You are a work in progress; which means you get there a little at a time, not all at once.
The more often you see something in your mind’s eye, the more quickly you’ll reach it. ~Ralph Marston
Moonlight floods the whole sky from horizon to horizon; How much it can fill your room depends on its windows. ~Rumi
As long as you want it, you’ll never have it. Be it, and it is yours. ~Ralph Marston
Pay attention to the ones who care before trying to get the attention of the ones who don’t. ~T. R. Wood
No matter what happens in life, keep a good heart. A heart of trust and patience. Don’t let the darkness of some people harden your heart.
He might have bought an action for damages against his countenance and won damages. ~Charles Dickens
A princely marriage is the brilliant edition of a universal fact, and as such it rivets mankind. ~Walter Bagehot
You will find as you grow older that the weight of rages will press harder and harder upon the employer. ~William Hayter Spooner
The more things are forbidden, the more popular they become. ~Mark Twain
God, please give us the courage to accept things for what they are, but to never lose hope that things will always get better.
Your successes and happiness are forgiven only if you generously consent to share them. ~Albert Camus
Surround yourself with those who see greatness in you, even when you don’t see it in yourself.
There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that’s your own self. ~Aldous Huxley
One’s destination is never a place, but rather a new way of looking at things. ~Henry Miller
Everything that has a beginning has an ending. Make your peace with that and all will be well. ~Buddha
One must learn by doing the thing; though you think you know it, you have no certainty until you try. ~Sophocles
Strive for perfection in everything you do… Accept nothing as nearly right or good enough. ~Sir Frederick Henry Royce
The only way of finding the limits of the possible is by going beyond them into the impossible. ~Arthur C. Clarke
Do what you fear and fear disappears.
I almost always urge people to write in the first person. Writing is an act of ego and you might as well admit it. ~William Zinsser
Thank you January, and welcome February. I love my past, and exciting for the next.
Don’t fear failure so much that you refuse to try new things. The saddest summary of a life contains three descriptions: could have, might have, and should have. ~Louis E. Boone
Investing isn’t about beating others at their game. It’s about controlling yourself at your own game. ~Jason Zweig
Women with money and women in power are two uncomfortable ideas in our society. ~Candace Bushnell
Realize that if you have time to whine and complain about something then you have time to do something about it. ~Anthony D’Angelo
The past cannot be changed, forgotten, edited or erased; it can only be accepted.
Win as if you were used to it, lose as if you enjoyed it for a change. ~Ralph Waldo Emerson
Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other. ~Walter Elliot
The first step toward success is taken when u refuse to be a captive of the environment in which u first find urself. ~Mark Caine
The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large. ~Confucius
Decide whether or not the goal is worth the risks involved. If it is, stop worrying. ~Amelia Earhart
If you want to feel rich, just count all the gifts you have that money can’t buy.
Never doubt that a small group of committed people can change the world. Indeed, it’s the only thing that ever has. ~Margaret Mead
By getting up early in the morning one also gets more time at his disposal for work as compared to late-risers. Scholar and thinkers get up early in the morning and contemplate. ~Rig Veda
The problems that exist in the world today cannot be solved by the level of thinking that created them. ~Albert Einstein
There is only one success, to be able to spend your life in your own way. ~Christopher Morley
You can close your eyes to things you don’t want to see, but you can’t close your heart to things you don’t want to feel.
What other people do does not affect you. What you think about what they do affects you. ~Dick Sutphen
To change who you are, change who you think you are. ~J. L. Huie
Power without responsibility - the prerogative of the harlot throughout the ages. ~Stanley Baldwin
In the boxing ring of life, it’s not how hard you hit, but how many times you can get hit and keep moving forward. ~Sylvester Stallone
Don’t put a limit on anything. The more you dream, the further you get. ~Michael Phelps
Every team faces adversity. Mediocre teams are destroyed by it. Good teams survive it. Great teams get better because of it. ~Urban Meyer
It’s the possibility of having a dream come true that makes life interesting.
Success is taken when you refuse to be a captive of the environment in which you first find yourself. ~Mark Caine
Raise your words, not voice. It is rain that grows flowers, not thunder. ~Rumi
Today I will do what others won’t, so tomorrow I can accomplish what others can’t. ~Jerry Rice
When you stop chasing the wrong things, you give the right things a chance to catch you.
I think big, and then allow myself to accept even more. ~Louise L. Hay
If you want to be respected by others, the great thing is to respect yourself. ~Fyodor Dostoevsky
Our lives happen in the seconds and the moments, not the minutes and the stories, we create by our choices in the moment. ~Bob Wright
Change is created by those whose imaginations are bigger than their circumstances. ~M. S. Beck
Always trust that you know what’s best for you. You are the only expert for your own life. ~John Sheen
Giving is better than receiving because giving starts the receiving process. ~Jim Rohn
We shall find peace. We shall hear the angels, we shall see the sky sparkling with diamonds. ~Anton Chekhov
Prepare for the new; expect the new; embrace the new. Otherwise, you’ll just repeat what’s old. ~Marianne Williamson
The man who does more than he is paid for will soon be paid for more than he does. ~Napoleon Hill
The major value in life is not what you get. The major value in life is what you become. ~Jim Rohn
